articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia, one of the world's biggest oil producers, has faced shortages of fuel crucial for gathering the harvest in some parts of its southern breadbasket and the situation may get worse in coming months, market sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Russia faces domestic fuel crunch, braces for more shortages

articles.author: Alex Lawler, Timothy Gardner
articles.description: Iran's oil output and exports jumped in August despite U.S. sanctions, according to consultants and companies that track tanker shipments, as Tehran sells to buyers including China.
articles.title: Iran's oil output, exports rise as Washington, Tehran talk

articles.author: Foo Yun Chee
articles.description: Microsoft (MSFT.O) will unbundle its chat and video app Teams from its Office product and make it easier for rival products to work with its software, the U.S. company said on Thursday in a move aimed at staving off a possible EU antitrust fine.
articles.title: Microsoft to unbundle Teams from Office, seeks to avert EU antitrust fine

articles.author: Jody Godoy
articles.description: A California judge is poised to decide if an online lender offering small loans at over 150% interest violates state law, which would deal a blow to finance companies that critics argue have skirted rate caps to profit from cash-strapped borrowers.
articles.title: California case could deal blow to high-interest online lenders

articles.author: Noele Illien
articles.description: UBS Group (UBSG.S) said on Thursday it would fully absorb Credit Suisse's domestic bank - a decision that comes despite a likely backlash in Switzerland where it could result in the loss of thousands of jobs.
articles.title: UBS to absorb Credit Suisse's domestic bank, eyes $10 bln in cost savings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Polish refiner Orlen has in recent months chartered at least 10 tankers that previously shipped Russian oil to Asia to deliver Arab crude to its refineries in Lithuania and Poland on their return journey, according to two traders and LSEG data.
articles.title: Exclusive: Poland charters tankers used for Russian oil to import Arab crude

articles.author: Engen Tham, Julie Zhu, Clare Jim
articles.description: In the beginning, Hui Ka Yan followed a simple formula. Borrow to buy land. Sell homes on the site before they are built. Use the cash to pay lenders and finance the next real estate project.
articles.title: How Evergrande’s collapse foreshadowed China’s property crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A newly released video of Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin purports to show him in Africa only days before his death, addressing speculation about his wellbeing and possible threats to his security.
articles.title: Late Russian mercenary Prigozhin spoke about his security in newly surfaced video

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Laurie Chen, Martin Pollard
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is likely to skip a summit of G20 leaders in India next week, sources familiar with the matter in India and China told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's Xi likely to skip G20 summit in India
